class Solution:
    def subsequenceSumAfterCapping(self, nums: List[int], k: int) -> List[bool]:
        c = Counter(nums)
        n = len(nums)
        pf = [0] * (n+1)
        pf[0] = 1
        fullMask = (1 << (k+1)) - 1
        # print(f'{fullMask=}')

        for v in range(1, n + 1):
            dp = pf[v-1]
            count = c[v]

            pp = 1
            while count > 0:
                take = min(pp, count)
                dp = (dp | (dp << (v*take)) & fullMask) & fullMask
                count -= take
                pp <<= 1

            pf[v] = dp

        suff = [0] * (n + 2)
        for v in range(n, 0, -1):
            suff[v] = suff[v+1] + c[v]

        res = [False]*n

        for x in range(1, n + 1):
            dp = pf[x-1]
            nxt = suff[x]
            big = min(nxt, k // x)
            noFail = False
            for j in range(big + 1):
                tmp = k - (j * x)
                if (dp >> tmp) & 1:
                    noFail = True
                    break
            res[x-1] = noFail

        return res

class Solution:
  def subsequenceSumAfterCapping(self, nums: List[int], k: int) -> List[bool]:
    n = len(nums)
    freq = [0] * (n + 1)
    for a in nums:
        if 1 <= a <= n:
            freq[a] += 1

    ans = [False] * n
    dp = 1
    mask = (1 << (k + 1)) - 1

    cnt_le = 0
    for x in range(1, n + 1):
        for _ in range(freq[x]):
            dp = (dp | (dp << x)) & mask
        cnt_le += freq[x]

        m_x = n - cnt_le

        possible = False
        max_j = min(m_x, k // x)
        for j in range(max_j + 1):
            s = k - j * x
            if (dp >> s) & 1:  # sum s is achievable using values ≤ x
                possible = True
                break
        ans[x - 1] = possible

    return ans

class Solution:
    def subsequenceSumAfterCapping(self, nums: List[int], k: int) -> List[bool]:
        K = k
        nums.sort()
        N = len(nums)
        dp = [0]*(k+1)
        j = 0
        dp[0] = 1

        Z = 1
        res = []
        for i in range(1,N+1):
            while j < len(nums) and nums[j] < i:
                Z |= (Z << nums[j])
                j += 1
            remaining_count = len(nums)-j
            max_cap = i
            ans = False
            for g in range(K,-1,-i):
                diff = k-g
                if remaining_count*max_cap >= diff:
                    if ((1<<g)&Z) > 0:
                        ans = True
                        break
                else:
                    break
            res.append(ans)
        return res
